markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Telekinetic Converter](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2417)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Gatewalkers</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 75

**Price** 1,950 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn gloves

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Copper cables run from these thick leather gloves to nodes that attach to the wearer's temples, allowing a spellcaster to convert the magic they normally cast to pure psychic intention. When you Cast a Spell using the _telekinetic converters_, you substitute any verbal spellcasting components for mental components of simple thought, granting the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait to the spell you're casting.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> Interact;     **Effect** You cast [_telekinetic projectile_](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) as an occult cantrip, heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> Interact;     **Effect** You cast your choice of [_telekinetic haul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=332) or [_telekinetic maneuver_](/Spells.aspx?ID=333) as a 5th-level occult spell, consuming one of your unexpended spell slots of the same level as if you had used it to cast the spell.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Telekinetic Converter
primary_source: Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires
primary_source_raw: Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires pg. 75
